item.title: XDefiant Releases Update 1 and Enables Practice Zone
item.description: Ubisoft's hit game XDefiant has released it's first update, featuring a number of much requested fixes and changes. The most notable of which is the re-introduction of Practice Zone, which had been dormant for much of the game's pre-season period.

item.title: Rumor: New First-Party PlayStation Game Reveal is Imminent
item.description:
Highlights

  • An insider hints at a new Astro Bot game announcement from Sony in the next two weeks.
  • Previous Astro Bot games garnered critical acclaim for innovative gameplay and DualSense controller use.
  • Speculation swirls around a potential PlayStation event in late May, which could possibly see a new Astro Bot game being unveiled.

A credible insider has claimed that Sony may be gearing up to announce a new Astro Bot game in the coming weeks. Rumors surrounding an imminent PlayStation event have been swirling heavily in the past few days, and Team Asobi's beloved robotic mascot could be a part of the proceedings.

The first Astro Bot game, Astro Bot Rescue Mission , launched in 2018 on PlayStation VR and immediately became a fan favorite. It was followed up by 2020's Astro's Playroom , which was a free pre-included game for the PS5. The charming platformer accrued significant critical acclaim and delighted players with its innovative use of the DualSense controller, as well as its homages to past PlayStation consoles and games. Since then, developer Team Asobi has been developing a new game , which the studio claims will be its biggest project to date.

Related
PlayStation Seemingly Teases May 2024 Showcase Event

Sony potentially teases a 2024 PlayStation Showcase scheduled for May, which could reveal the company's long-term plans for the PS5 generation.

As it seems, fans could soon get to see what the studio has been working on, as a new report from reliable leaker billbil-kun writing for Dealabs claims that Team Asobi is planning to unveil the next Astro Bot game in the next 15 days. The report alleges that the game could simply be dubbed Astro Bot , although the leaker isn't too sure of this. It's also been claimed that one of the new characters in the game will be a robotic fennec fox that "shares some resemblances" with Astro, and that a part of the game will be playable in a desert environment. This may validate an earlier rumor that alleged an Astro Bot sequel was in development .

The Next Astro Bot Game Might Skip an Important Platform

Details surrounding a release window or launch platforms were unavailable in the report, although the leaker speculates that the game will be released only on PS5, and skip PlayStation VR2 entirely. Considering Astro Bot Rescue Mission was one of the best games for the original PSVR headset, the upcoming Astro Bot game potentially forgoing Sony's current-generation VR headset would be surprising, especially when PlayStation VR2 is reportedly struggling sales-wise . However, it's ultimately an assumption from the leaker, so a VR2 launch for the next Astro Bot game shouldn't be ruled out.

More importantly, though, the rumored announcement of a new Astro Bot game coincides with speculation surrounding a PlayStation event at the end of May. Industry insiders like Jeff Grubb and Nick Baker have hinted at an event happening around May 28, with the exact format (State of Play or PlayStation Showcase) yet to be confirmed. Dealabs' recent report about Firewalk Studio's PS5 shooter Concord being revealed in the same timeframe as the Astro Bot title also lends potential credence to the notion of some type of PlayStation event being announced imminently. If the rumors are to be believed, then the upcoming week should be very interesting for PlayStation fans.

item.title: A New Kung Fu Panda Game Could be in the Works
item.description:
Highlights

  • A new Kung Fu Panda game appears to be in the works, titled The Warrior's Gauntlet, but release platforms remain a mystery.
  • Previous video game adaptations of Dreamworks properties suggest The Warrior's Gauntlet may be cross-platform.
  • It's likely that the new game will be combat-focused or a fighting game, potentially inspired by Kung Fu Panda 4.

Coming off the heels of a brand-new Kung Fu Panda movie from Dreamworks, a video game adaptation is apparently in the works from an unknown developer/publisher, seemingly titled Kung Fu Panda: The Warrior's Gauntlet . There is currently no information about the game's release, including what platforms it may be on, but previous video games based on Dreamworks properties have appeared on most current and last-gen consoles, so it seems likely for a cross-platform launch as well.

This would not be the first video game based on Kung Fu Panda, as the original film trilogy received several adaptations across multiple platforms, followed by the 2015 fighting game title Kung Fu Panda: Showdown of Legendary Legends. Jack Black's titular panda bear Po and the Furious Five have also appeared in several other video games as tie-in crossovers such as Minecraft , Brawlhalla, and the mobile game Castle Clash.

Related
Every Kung Fu Panda Movie, Ranked

DreamWorks Animation's Kung Fu Panda has produced four enjoyable movies, but they are not all equal.

After a class nine trademark filing appeared on the Global Brand Database on May 21, it appears that Dreamworks is taking another stab at turning a beloved franchise into a video game , as it confirmed development on Kung Fu Panda: The Warrior's Gauntlet. The listing doesn't provide many details aside from the title, which is likely subject to change, and the region for the trademark, which is the European Union.

What is the New Kung Fu Panda Game?

The filing's classification doesn't provide much context, either, as it simply confirms that the trademark is for a video game to be released on multiple platforms, without confirming which ones. It mentions mobile devices, consoles, and computer software, so it currently remains unknown where the game will actually release, though all previous Dreamworks games have been multiplatform.

While little is known about The Warrior's Gauntlet, it seems likely to be a combat-focused action game or even a fighting game, given the franchise's focus on martial arts. Previous video game tie-ins and spinoffs for the franchise have mostly focused on these aspects, and as the title implies, the new one seems to be taking on similar elements.

The Warrior's Gauntlet will likely take inspiration from Kung Fu Panda 4 , the most recent film, meaning players may get to see some new characters and mechanics based on it. In the meantime, there is little else to go on as far as details about the game go at the moment, so fans will have to wait until Dreamworks or the developers themselves officially announce the title.

item.title: XDefiant's Launch Breaks Ubisoft Record
item.description:
Highlights

  • XDefiant broke records by reaching one million users in record time for Ubisoft, signaling a strong start for the game's future success.
  • Despite server issues, XDefiant attracted over 500,000 concurrent users on launch day, showcasing the game's popularity and potential.
  • With upcoming updates addressing bugs and hit registration, XDefiant aims to maintain its positive reception among players and community figures.

XDefiant became Ubisoft's fastest-ever game to reach one million unique users, according to an established insider's sources. 48 hours after its launch, XDefiant had reached an even more impressive number of players, as Ubisoft looks to maintain the success of its newest hit.

Ever since its announcement, XDefiant has been positioned by many as a Call of Duty competitor due to its resemblance to CoD titles from earlier in the 21st century. However, XDefiant has thrown in plenty of features to set itself apart from Activision's megalithic franchise, whether that be faction abilities, a modern but relatively stripped-down movement system, or the surprising decision to ditch skill-based matchmaking altogether. While XDefiant still has a long road ahead if it intends to challenge CoD 's supremacy in the genre, it seems to be off to a fantastic start.

Related
XDefiant Players Frustrated By Weapon Level Progression Speed

The recently released FPS from Ubisoft, XDefiant, is annoying some players with its allegedly slow-paced weapon level progression system.

In addition to XDefiant 's impressive feat of reaching one million unique players within two and a half hours, the game also went on to reach over three million unique users within 48 hours of its launch, per Insider Gaming's sources . This easily beats out one of Ubisoft's last viral free-to-play launches, Apex Legends , which took eight hours to reach one million unique players. Also, over 500,000 concurrent users were logged in to XDefiant at one point on launch day, despite server issues that have since been fixed. Since Ubisoft usually doesn't publicly share its player numbers, it's unclear where XDefiant now stands about 72 hours after its launch, but it seems unlikely that its success will slow down in the immediate future.

XDefiant's Record-Breaking Start

  • Reached one million unique users within two and a half hours, making it Ubisoft's most successful launch ever
  • Went on to reach three million unique users within 48 hours of its launch
  • Despite major server issues, the game reached 500,000 concurrent users on launch day

XDefiant 's core gameplay appears to be a hit with many players despite its early bugs and server complications, so it seems the game's continued success could come down to post-launch support and future development decisions. Ubisoft's devs just released XDefiant 's first update , which included various fixes for the Practice Zone, netcode, and other gameplay problems.

Recently, a senior XDefiant dev also confirmed that a hit registration patch is in the works, although a release window for the update is still unknown. The game is set to receive its major Season 1 update sometime this summer, possibly on July 2 if it begins immediately after the preseason concludes, which has a confirmed runtime of six weeks.

Despite the early issues, XDefiant has been well-received by both community figures and players. AAA arena-style FPS titles have been rare releases in recent years, partially due to the massive popularity of the battle royale format, but XDefiant seems to be turning into the subgenre's first success story in a while.

item.title: June 18 is Going to Be a Sad Day for PS Plus Subscribers
item.description: On June 18, PlayStation Plus Extra and Premium tiers will be losing a significant number of games—12 in total. Out of these, one game is exclusive to PS Plus Premium subscribers, while the remaining 11 are available to both Extra and Premium members.
